page.title: 10Landscape east: FINTRY
page.content:
This area consists of relatively steep land of{igneous}origin which has been covered by deposits of{boulder clay} and{glacial sands and gravels.}The River Endrick has exposed softer{ {sedimentary}rocks and eaten a steep sided valley up as far as the{Fintry {Loup}(665.861). This is a spectacular waterfall formed where the river plunges over a series of lava flows.
{Loch Walton,}for some time a fish nursery, was formed after the ice age amongst various{glacial deposits.}The{ {Carron Reservoir}is the other large tract of water in the area. It was formed by damming the Carron Valley and provides water locally and to the Grangemouth area.
The highest point in this square is 321m.
